snippet.title: Ladies show pedal power
snippet.content:
THESE six women all love their cycling.
So much so, Bicycle Queensland has made them ambassadors for this year's Brisbane to Gold Coast Cycle Challenge in October.
The move is aimed at encouraging more women to take up cycling.
Ruthie McGrath, of Wynnum West, Cathy Peel, of Kangaroo Point, Mt Gravatt's Jan Stevenson, Carmen Weier, of Acacia Ridge, Kelvin Grove's Karen Bucholz and Sheree Hughes, of Mitchelton, will wear purple B2GC jerseys, so other female riders can find them on the day of the event.
Event manager Phoebe Kinley hoped it would have a positive impact on women riding in B2GC.
"We feel that having dedicated women riding as ambassadors reflects the wide range of female cyclists - from first-time riders right up to elite racers," Ms Kinley said.
For more details, visit b2gc.com.au
